page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: THE AREA IS BISECTED BY THE RIVER TEME WITH THE VALLEY FLOOR BEING INTENSIVELY FARMED WITH HOPS, CORN AND GRASS. THE GROUND SLOPES GENTLY UP THROUGH ORCHARDS ON THE NORTH, AND MORE STEEPLY WITH WOODS AND GRASSLAND, ON THE SOUTH. FARMS,SMALLHOLDINGS AND COTTAGES ARE SCATTERED ALL OVER WITH A CLUSTER OF DWELLINGS AT HIGHWOOD, A GROUP OF COUCIL HOUSING AT EASTHAM, AND A VILLAGE AT NEWNHAM BRIDGE WITH TWO PUBS,A SHOP AND POST OFFICE. IN SPRING AND DURING THE HOP HARVEST,CARAVAN ENCAMPMENTS OF CASUAL WORKERS APPEAR,BUT MANY PEOPLE RESIDENT IN THE AREA NOW WORK OUTSIDE THE AGRICULTURAL INDUSTRY AND COMMUTE TO THE BLACK COUNTRY, OR ARE SELF EMPLOYED.THE VALLEY IS VERY BEAUTIFUL, SCENICALLY AND ATTRACTS MANY VISITORS ESPECIALLY AT BLOSSOM TIME.
